node.text:
LEAF PAINTING 🍁🍂🍃🌿- I’m reposting this fun LIVE I did with @mastermindtoys on Friday because there are so many fun leaf painting techniques! And I love that you can use so many different kinds of paint and supplies to make beautiful art 🤩 Sorry the sound is a little off 🙈 the Lives can do that. Let me know in the comments below if you guys would like to see more craft and art tutorial lives! ❤️
.
.
Here’s what you need:
-Leaves 🍂🍁🌿
-Paint - we used watercolors, acrylic and puffy paint (special thanks to @colormadehappy for the puffy paint idea)
-White cardstock 
.
.
For the full post head to thebestideasforkids.com and search “Leaf Painting” or head to: https://www.thebestideasforkids.com/leaf-painting/
.
.
Follow us at @bestideasforkids for more fun kids crafts and activities 🌈 🎨 
.
.
For the giveaway by @mastermindtoys this is open to Canadian residents 18+. This giveaway is not affiliated or endorsed by Instagram. 
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
LETTER MATCH SENSORY BAG 🔠
Here’s a fun way to practice lowercase and uppercase letters 🤩 If you’re just working on lowercase or uppercase only you can do a matching activity with just the one too. 💛💚💙❤️
.
Here’s what you need:
-Sealed top bag (we used Large Ziploc bags)
-Permanent Markers
-Clear Hair Gel
-Letter Magnets 
.
Use a circle shape like a cup to draw your circles. Add letters inside for matching. We did lowercase and uppercase letters. Add in hair gel. You want enough so the letters are easy to move around. Then add in your letters and seal the bag. For extra protection you can add some duct tape to the top.
You can use alphabet beads and use smaller circles too! 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kids crafts and activities 🌈 🎨 .
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
CARDBOARD BALLERINA 🩰 

How many nature 🍃🍂 backdrops can you find for this cardboard ballerina 🩰 craft? 
Swipe 👉 to see all of the pretty nature backdrops we did.

Making this is really easy if you have cardboard on hand. 🙌 And the fun part is exploring 🔍 🌳 outside to see what backdrops you can give the ballerina’s skirt! 😍

There’s a printable template available too on my site if you want help tracing the design. 🤩

You can get the template on the post, at thebestideasforkids.com and search “Cardboard Ballerina”. 

For a twist you can attach some sticky contact paper behind and have kids add flowers or leaves to the skirt instead. 

Here’s what you need:
-Cardboard
-Black Marker
-Heavy Duty Scissors (adults to cut)

For more fun recycled ♻️ crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.
.
.
.

node.text:
HANDPRINT CARDS 🤚 
If you’ve been following me for awhile, you guys know I love handprint crafts 🥰🤚
I usually prefer to use paper because painting can be difficult to do (and I’m by no means a great painter 😆). 

So this kit is PERFECT if you’re not a great painter like me 👩‍🎨 because it comes with all of the stickers and cardstock pieces you need to transform those adorable little handprints into these cute designs. It makes 8 handprint cards and comes with colorful envelopes too. 😍🌈 It’s the perfect gift and keepsake to preserve those cute little handprints. 🤚

And this kit is now available on Amazon in the US 🙌 and internationally on Scrapbook.com 🥳 (see the link in my bio)

Warning ⚠️ these are literally so cute when they are finished you may not want to give them away 😂 (I kept most of mine 🤫)

Swipe 👉 to see all of the designs the kit makes. 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
SURPRISE LEAF PAPER TOWEL ACTIVITY🍁 🍂 🎨 🤩
Have some markers and paper towels? 🙌 🎨 

This is a fun color learning activity or even just to do for a rainy afternoon. It’s super easy to set up, and kids can even draw the leaves themselves! 

First step is to draw your image with washable markers. I did different colored leaves 🍁🍂 for fall. You can do Halloween theme 🎃 or a rainbow also! 🌈

Then draw on top with a sharpie (adults you will have to help with this for younger kids). 
🖍 

Use a dropper to add water on top to “reveal” the color. The washable marker will come out from the black sharpie and creates a fun effect on your paper towel! 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
.

.
.
.
.
.

node.text:
SUNCATCHERS ☀️ 🤩
One of the prettiest and easiest crafts from my new line of craft kits now available on Amazon and Scrapbook.com (link in bio)

Swipe 👉 to see how they shine in the sun. These are actually the #1 item from the line- let me know if you had a chance to try them!😍

Have you made suncatchers before? I have a few different ones on my site too. But here’s what’s included in the kit: cardstock shapes, sticky adhesive paper, tissue paper squares, adhesive dots. 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.

node.text:
SURPRISE LEAF PAINTING 🍃 🍁 🍂 
Here’s a fun little twist on the classic crayon 🖍 rub leaf art.🙌

🍂Put leaves vein side up under regular white paper
🍂Use a white crayon on top of a piece of paper. Make sure to rub all over the leaf so you get all of the vein impressions
🍂Use watercolors on top to “reveal” the magically appearing leaf 

This makes the prettiest leaf art 😍🍃🍂
Kids of all ages can do this! 
And if you haven’t tried the classic crayon rub🖍 leaf art, try this 👉 place the leaf under a piece of paper and rub any colored crayon on top. 

For more crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.

.
.

Say hello to these cute little guys that also stand up with the clothespins (swipe 👉 to see them standing)! 😍🍂

Make your own shapes or grab the template on the post if you want help tracing the design. 🤩 ✏️ 🌈

You can get the template on the post, at thebestideasforkids.com and search “Scarecrow Craft”.

node.text:
WATERCOLOR GEOMETRIC LEAVES 🍃 🍂🍁
I guess I’m loving watercolors lately 😍 Head to my feed to see the latest painting with leaves 🍃 that use watercolors too. 🎨 

Want to know the best part about painting with watercolors? They are so much easier to clean up. 🙌 Really, 😎 because they’re already water based the clean-up is so simple. And if you use a washable, kid-friendly brand than it’s even better. The results turn out great when using kids washable watercolors unlike some washable paint that can go on almost transparent-like. 

Did you see the dinosaur 🦕 🦖 versions like these? They were such a hit I decided to make a fall version (thank you to a reader for the inspiration 🤩).

This easy watercolor art project can be done by kids of all ages! And if you don’t have watercolor paints, kids can even just color in the shapes with crayons. To make it easier for younger kids, skip the crayon step. 

What other themes like this would you like to see? Let me know down below and also tag someone you think might like to try this art!

Here’s what you need:
Watercolor paints 🎨 
White cardstock 📄 
Black crayon or black oil pastel 🖍 
Leaf templates 🍂🍃- you can get them on the post at thebestideasforkids.com

Directions:
Have kids outline the template with a black crayon.
Paint the shapes inside with watercolors. 

Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and activity ideas. 🖍✂️
.
Save this post for later by clicking the flag 🏳️at the bottom of the post ❤️
.
.
. 
.

node.text:
WATERCOLOR LEAF PAINTING 🍃 🍁 🍂 
Here’s a simple but beautiful way to make leaf art with kids!
Add a few different watercolors to the vein side of a leaf. Press onto cardstock or watercolor paper.
This makes the prettiest leaf art 😍🍃🍂
Kids of all ages can do this! 
And if you haven’t tried the classic crayon rub🖍 leaf art, try this 👉 place the leaf under a piece of paper and rub a crayon on top. 

For more crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
.

.

node.text:
SIDEWALK CHALK PAINT 🎨 🌈🤩
Making your own sidewalk chalk paint is easy - and a perfect use for all of the little bits and pieces that are too hard to draw with! 🙌

Follow me @bestideasforkids for more fun crafts and activities! 🌈 

Ingredients
* 	2 tbsp cornstarch
* 	2 tbsp water If not painting well enough, add 1 extra tablespoon of water and mix in
* 	1/2 tbsp sidewalk chalk Or approx 1/4 to 1/2 a piece of chalk 

Add 2 tablespoons of cornstarch into a measuring cup.

Add 2 tablespoons of water into the cup and mix. Note: if you find the paint does not paint well, add an additional tablespoon of water.

Grate sidewalk chalk to get approx 1/2 tablespoon of chalk. Add it into the cup or the muffin tin and then mix with the cornstarch and water. 

If you would rather not grate the chalk, place the chalk pieces into a ziploc bag and bang with a rolling pin until it turns into a similar consistency.

Repeat for each color you'd like to make.

This sidewalk chalk paint will make one muffin cup of paint. If you want to fill your muffin tin you will need to repeat the recipe for each color.
You can also double or triple the recipe and make a larger batch and then split it into smaller containers and add the sidewalk chalk in last to save time.

Save this post for later  and tag a friend that might like to try it! ❤️
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft and recipe ideas. 🖍✂️ .

node.text:
PAPER CRAYON CARDS🖍 🌈

These little crayon 🖍 cuties can be used as a fun back to school 🏫 about me activity (what’s your favorite color?), bulletin board decor or a writing prompt to go with The Day the Crayons 🖍 Quit book. You can also leave the inside blank and use it however you’d like!

✏️ Should I make a matching pencil? 🤔 

There’s a printable template available too (right on the post) if you want help tracing the design. 🤩🖍🌈 

You can get the template on the post, at thebestideasforkids.com and search “Crayon Template”. 
.
For more fun crafts, see my book called, Fun and Easy Crafting with Recycled Materials. 
.
Follow me at @bestideasforkids for more fun kid craft ideas. 🖍✂️
